page.title: 11Fir Tree.
page.content: Fir Tree is a small village which stretches along the busy A68 road where it joins the road from Howden-Le-Wear and was originally used as one of the important drove-roads between Scotland and England.There is evidence of ancient British settlements in the area. Since the mid 19th.century,Fir Tree housed miners working local collieries but these have now closed down. Fir Tree now comprises of a small council estate four streets,two inns, a post office and a Methodist Chapel. The church was originally a school room.Apart from the building of several private houses the village has hardly changed in over forty years.
